description: India and Thailand have strengthened their relationship, forming a strategic partnership to address security and economic concerns in the Indo-Pacific region. They signed five cooperation agreements, focusing on tourism, education, and technology, and committed to combatting human trafficking. Modi emphasized cooperation in renewable energy, digital technology, and FinTech.
title: India, Thailand boost strategic ties with focus on Asean unity

description: Rajya Sabha saw a heated debate on the waqf bill, with NCP's Praful Patel and JDS's HD Deve Gowda supporting it and criticizing Congress for its stance. Patel pointed out Sena's controversial past, while Gowda praised PM Modi's efforts to safeguard waqf properties and emphasized India's secular values.
title: NDA's new 'secular' entrants, NCP and JDS, support waqf bill

description: Rahul Gandhi criticized the government in Lok Sabha for allegedly losing 4,000 sq km of territory to China and questioned the measures against US-imposed import tariffs affecting India's economy. BJP's Anurag Thakur countered, blaming previous Congress regimes for territorial losses and financial controversies.
title: Rahul Gandhi says China has grabbed 4,000 sqkm, Anurag Thakur hits back

description: The Supreme Court's annulment of over 25,000 teacher recruitments by the West Bengal government is expected to expedite the Enforcement Directorate's investigation into alleged money laundering by TMC functionaries. This includes high-profile figures such as Partha Chatterjee and Arpita Mukherjee, with substantial assets seized and fresh summons anticipated.
title: Supreme Court verdict out, ED probe into West Bengal job scam to shift gears

description: Minority affairs minister Kiren Rijiju refuted the opposition's claims about the new waqf law being anti-Muslim. He emphasized that the legislation aims to improve the management of waqf properties and address past governments' unfulfilled objectives, ensuring usage for the benefit of Muslims.
title: Waqf bill seeks to complete unfinished tasks of previous governments: Kiren Rijiju

description: Over 260 passengers on a Virgin Atlantic flight from London to Mumbai have been stranded at Turkiye's Diyarbakır airport for the past 24 hours due to a medical emergency and technical glitch. Passengers reportedly lacked basic amenities or clear information on their departure time, while the airline worked to resolve the issues.
title: 260 on London-Mumbai flight stranded in Turkiye since Wednesday

description: Supreme Court judges, led by CJI Sanjiv Khanna, have agreed to publicly disclose their assets and liabilities following the discovery of cash at a high court judge's residence. The practice, started in 2009 but discontinued after a few years, is set to resume.
title: After cash pile row, SC judges resolve to post assets, liabilities online
Fire erupts on mall terrace

description: PM Narendra Modi highlighted India's Northeast as crucial for the Bimstec region during the summit in Thailand. There's a planned bilateral meeting with Bangladesh's Muhammad Yunus after recent remarks implying the Northeast states are landlocked. Additionally, India's investment in regional connectivity projects was emphasized.
title: In counter to Yunus's remark, PM Modi says Northeast integral to Bimstec

description: The House confirmed the imposition of President's rule in Manipur after the situation saw no deaths in the past four months. Home minister Amit Shah highlighted ongoing efforts to restore peace between the Meitei and Kuki communities. Congress and Trinamool Congress support the resolution but urge for quick restoration of peace and stability.
title: Lok Sabha adopts resolution on Manipur well past 1am Thursday

description: The Parliament of India approved the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2025 after intense debates, highlighting its aim to reform Waqf property management and address corruption. The Bill passed with majority support, despite opposition accusations of it being unconstitutional and biased against the Muslim minority. The Bill now awaits the President's assent to become law.
title: Parliament passes Waqf Amendment Bill 2025

description: Flight Lieutenant Siddharth Yadav, who died in an IAF Jaguar crash in Gujarat, had been engaged just 10 days prior and was set to marry in November. From a family with military roots, Siddharth's demise has cast a pall over planned celebrations in Rewari. IAF expressed deep regret and support for his grieving family.
title: Pilot killed in Gujarat Jaguar crash had got engaged just 10 days ago

description: The governance dispute at Gokhale Institute of Politics and Economics has intensified after trustees replaced economist Sanjeev Sanyal with ex-judge SC Dharmadhikari as chancellor. Interim VC Shankar Das challenged the decision, citing UGC regulations, while the Servants of India Society accused Sanyal of inaction over the institution's declining credentials, prompting demands for a new chancellor.
title: Sanjeev Sanyal sacked as GIPE chancellor, fresh row breaks out

description: Supreme Court has affirmed Calcutta High Court's decision to cancel the 2016 recruitment of more than 25,700 teachers and non-teaching staff in West Bengal. The process was found to be tainted with manipulation and fraud. Non-tainted candidates won't have to refund salaries. They can apply to their previous government positions, though their disputed employment period won't be compensated.
title: Supreme Court quashes 'tainted' selection of 25,752 Bengal school staff

description: Tyeb Mehta's 'Trussed Bull' sold for Rs 61.8 crore, marking it the second most expensive Indian painting at auction globally. The sale at Saffronart's 25th anniversary auction highlights a strong art market. Mehta's life and art were deeply influenced by historical events and personal experiences, with his powerful imagery reflecting societal struggles.
title: Tyeb Mehta's bull run continues: 2nd priciest Indian painting at 61.8cr
‘Fugitive’ terrorists spotted in Udhampur, search launched

description: J&K CM Omar Abdullah has convened a meeting to address tensions arising from LG Manoj Sinha's recent transfer of 48 JKAS officers. The NC alleges this undermines the democratic process. The issue will likely be discussed during Union home minister Amit Shah’s upcoming visit to J&K.
title: In a first, Omar calls meet to discuss LG’s decision

description: Jammu and Kashmir Police has identified 200 social media handles involved in spreading radicalisation and glorifying terrorism. Efforts by the cyber cell over the past three months have led to the identification of these handles, with 100 operating from outside the country. Multiple FIRs have been filed, and some individuals influenced by this content have been de-radicalised.
title: J&K Police identifies 200 social media handles involved in radicalisation

description: Sidney Crosby, Pittsburgh Penguins legend, has joined Swiss watchmaking company NORQAIN as a shareholder and brand ambassador. Founded in 2018, NORQAIN has links to both Breitling and NHL players. Crosby expressed his excitement about collaborating with NORQAIN, and co-founder Mark Streit considers it a perfect match due to their shared values and work ethic.
title: 3-time Stanley Cup Champion Sidney Crosby owns stake in Swiss watchmaking company

description: Mumbai Indians’ Rohit Sharma and Lucknow Super Giants’ Rishabh Pant shared a warm hug before their IPL 2025 match. The video went viral, showing their camaraderie. Both teams have had an inconsistent start this season. MI, led by Hardik Pandya, face challenges, while LSG rely on Nicholas Pooran and Mitchell Marsh for good performance.
title: 'Abhi mereko koi karne ki jarurat nahi hai': Rohit Sharma's comment goes viral

description: Senior JD(U) leader Mohammed Qasim Ansari resigns, citing the party's support for the Waqf Amendment Bill 2024. Accusing JD(U) of betraying secular principles and violating constitutional rights, he expresses regret over his long association with the party.
title: 'Against Indian Muslims': JD(U) leader resigns over party's stand on Waqf Bill

description: Technology stocks tumbled as President Trump's new tariff policies incited market panic, with Apple leading the sharp decline at nearly 9%. The Nasdaq Composite fell over 5%, its worst performance in five years. Trump imposed tariffs on imports, including a 34% tax on China, escalating fears of a global trade war.
title: Apple stock leads Tech decline as Trump’s tariff triggers market panic

description: Ajinkya Rahane of Kolkata Knight Riders expressed satisfaction with the Eden Gardens pitch ahead of their IPL 2025 match against Sunrisers Hyderabad. Rahane's comment came amidst recent controversy over the pitch conditions. Sunrisers Hyderabad won the toss and opted to bowl first, aiming to overturn last season's results where KKR dominated. High stakes are expected in this match.
title: 'At home, you should get what you want': Rahane amid Eden pitch controversy

description: India’s Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla will pilot the Axiom-4 mission to the ISS, involving around 60 scientific studies, with seven from India. The mission will focus on microgravity research, impacting biological processes and strategies for long-term space missions. It will include comprehensive research from nations like the US, Poland, Hungary, and others, contributing to global scientific progress.
title: Ax-4 mission will see around 60 experiments, including 7 led by Isro

description: Tamil Nadu CM M K Stalin has strongly opposed the Waqf Amendment Bill, claiming it threatens religious harmony and minority rights. He plans to challenge the Bill in the Supreme Court. The DMK's loud opposition to the Bill seems to be a strategic political move ahead of the upcoming state assembly elections.
title: Black badge protest: How Stalin is trying to make most of Waqf politics

description: Minnesota Timberwolves star Anthony Edwards was rumored to have prepaid 18 years of child support, but his ex, Ayesha Howard, clarified that no such arrangement exists. Howard debunked this misinformation, expressing frustration over the spread of falsehoods. Additionally, Edwards faced previous allegations from another woman about pressuring her to terminate a pregnancy.
title: Did Anthony Edwards offer $1M for 18 yrs of child support? Ayesha breaks silence

description: Television stars Eisha Singh and Avinash Mishra made a comeback with their new song Kala Sha Kala. Eisha addressed the trolling she faced post Bigg Boss 18, emphasizing her positivity and self-improvement. Avinash supported her, noting that all contestants experience both criticism and support.
title: Exclusive - Eisha Singh reacts to dealing with trolls after Bigg Boss 18

description: The Supreme Court has ruled that public servants who exceed their official powers are still protected from prosecution under Section 170 of the Police Act, provided there is a reasonable connection between their actions and their official duties. The safeguard requires prior government sanction before any legal proceedings can be initiated.
title: Govt officer accused of exceeding power can’t be prosecuted without prior sanction: SC

description: Indian Air Force pilot Flight Lieutenant Siddharth Yadav tragically died in a Jaguar fighter jet crash in Jamnagar, Gujarat. He was a brilliant student, engaged to be married, and from a family with a strong military background. The crash occurred during a night mission due to technical malfunction.
title: 'He got engaged days ago': Father of IAF pilot who died in Gujarat crash

description: The United States of Kailasa, led by fugitive Swami Nithyananda, claims to be a sovereign Hindu nation with its own currency and passports. However, 20 of its followers were arrested in Bolivia for illegal land agreements. Nithyananda, accused of serious crimes in India, argues these are conspiracies against him.
title: How Nithyananda's Kailasa 'land trafficked' Bolivia's indigenous people

description: US President Donald Trump announced a 10% baseline tariff on all imports starting April 5. Additional tariffs on specific countries will begin on April 9. These tariffs target nations with unfair trade practices. India, the UK, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, China, the EU, Japan, and Southeast Asian nations are affected. This policy could reshape global trade dynamics.
title: India, China and the Penguin: Winners and losers of Trump's tariff war

description: Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) triumphed over Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) by 80 runs in IPL 2025, powered by Venkatesh Iyer’s explosive 60 off 29 balls and Vaibhav Arora's 3-wicket haul. KKR set a formidable total of 200/6 and dismissed SRH for 120, showcasing strong teamwork and a dominant performance at Eden Gardens, Kolkata.
title: IPL 2025: Iyer, Arora lead KKR to dominating 80-run victory over SRH

description: Gujarat Titans pacer Kagiso Rabada has returned to South Africa for personal reasons during the IPL 2025 season. Rabada played two matches, taking two wickets, before being replaced by Arshad Khan. The Titans, having secured Rabada for Rs 10.75 crore, will miss his presence but have other pace options. They face Sunrisers Hyderabad next.
title: IPL: Gujarat Titans' Kagiso Rabada returns to South Africa

description: Opposition leaders criticized Prime Minister Modi over the US's 27 percent tariff on Indian goods. Rahul Gandhi and other MPs warned of severe impacts on industries like automobiles and pharmaceuticals. They urged the government to respond strongly, highlighting the economic risks and questioning Modi's handling of US relations.
title: 'It's time govt develop a spine': Oppn rips into PM Modi over US tariff

description: Rohit Sharma's playful interaction with Shardul Thakur and Zaheer Khan set a lighthearted tone before the IPL 2025 match between Lucknow Super Giants and Mumbai Indians. Despite recent struggles, both teams aim for a crucial win. MI, led by Hardik Pandya, face challenges with batting consistency, while LSG rely on Nicholas Pooran's explosive form.
title: 'Khudko The Lord bol raha hai': Watch Rohit's banter with Shardul Thakur

description: Biju Janata Dal emphasizes the importance of justice, harmony, and community rights regarding the Waqf Amendment Bill in Rajya Sabha. The party did not issue a whip, encouraging its members to vote according to their conscience despite announcing opposition to the bill.
title: 'No party whip': BJD tells MPs to 'exercise conscience' on Waqf Bill
'Op is over, the patient lived': Trump after levying reciprocal tariffs

description: The most viable option for India at this stage would be to conclude India-US trade agreement discussions and reach a consensus which would help both countries to align for respective economic growth.
title: Opinion: Will India Inc outshine US’s ‘Liberation’?

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Bangladesh chief adviser Muhammad Yunus were seen together at the BIMSTEC dinner table amidst worsening India-Bangladesh relations. The tension arose from Yunus' remarks about India's Northeast during his China visit, which Indian politicians criticized as provocative.
title: PM Modi, Yunus sit together at BIMSTEC dinner table, likely to meet tomorrow

description: Former RBI governor Raghuram Rajan criticised the Trump administration’s new reciprocal tariffs, calling them a 'self-goal' that will harm the US economy in the short term. Rajan notes that the impact on India will be relatively smaller and suggests India reduce domestic tariffs to boost trade and competitiveness despite the global trend towards protectionism.
title: 'Self-goal': Raghuram Rajan uses football analogy for Trump's tariffs

description: Today's top stories include celebrity controversies and reflections on career turns. Highlights feature Ridhi Dogra defending her cross-border collaboration with Fawad Khan and Kareena Kapoor Khan dismissing Botox in favor of natural beauty. Also covered are Anupria Goenka's casting insights and Barkha Bisht's candid remarks on her past relationship.
title: Top 5 entertainment news

description: The US stock market saw a sharp decline as the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell by 1,400 points, or 3.3%, following President Trump’s new tariffs on imports. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite also dropped, reflecting a global market sell-off. Economists warn these tariffs could lower US economic growth and increase inflation, potentially leading to a recession.
title: Trump tariffs: Dow Jones drops 1,400 points, US market leads global sell-off

description: Venkatesh Iyer's blistering 60 off 29 balls helped Kolkata Knight Riders set a competitive total of 200/6 against Sunrisers Hyderabad in their IPL 2025 clash. This was Iyer’s third successive fifty against SRH. Contributions from Rahane, Raghuvanshi, and Singh also bolstered KKR's score, emphasising the significance of domestic cricket in player development.
title: Venkatesh Iyer’s love affair with SRH continues, joins an elite list

description: Approximately $1.7 trillion was wiped from the US' S&P 500 Index as markets opened due to fears of President Trump's tariffs potentially triggering a recession. Key companies like Apple, Nike, and Walmart, with overseas manufacturing, recorded major declines.
title: Wall Street crash: Nearly $2tn wiped as Trump's tariffs shake US markets
'We want to turn Pakistan into a Hindu Rashtra': BJP's Nitesh Rane

description: The White House has fired three National Security Council staffers following a meeting between President Trump and far-right activist Laura Loomer. Loomer questioned the loyalty of NSC members, prompting the dismissals. The three officials ousted are Brian Walsh, Thomas Boodry, and David Feith. An NSC spokesperson declined to comment on personnel matters.
title: White House ousts NSC staffers after Trump's meeting with Laura Loomer

description: Paul Heyman has stirred the wrestling world by ranking Roman Reigns as the number one wrestler, followed by CM Punk. He downplayed John Cena’s skills and strength, stating CM Punk is above him, but not above Roman Reigns. This ranking adds excitement to the upcoming WrestleMania 41, where these WWE superstars will battle.
title: WWE’s Paul Heyman dismisses John Cena in favor of Roman Reigns and CM Punk

description: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee has rejected the Waqf Amendment Bill passed by the Lok Sabha, expressing determination to nullify it once the BJP is ousted. During a presser, she accused the BJP of attempting to divide the country with the bill, which passed with 288 votes in favor and 232 against.
title: 'Will bring amendment to nullify Waqf Bill': Mamata Banerjee

description: Union minister Giriraj Singh sharply criticized Congress over the Waqf Amendment Bill, accusing the party of past appeasement. Singh highlighted how the BJP-led government rectified the mistakes from 2013. The Lok Sabha passed the bill after an extended debate, aiming to improve Waqf property administration.
title: '100 choohe kha kar billi Haj ko chali': Giriraj Singh slams Cong on Waqf Bill

description: Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde criticizes Uddhav Thackeray for opposing the Waqf Amendment Bill, accusing Thackeray of abandoning Hindutva. Shinde defends the bill's intent to reform Waqf property administration, while Thackeray condemns what he calls BJP's hypocrisy.
title: 'Abandoned ideals of Balasaheb': Shinde slams Uddhav on Waqf Bill

description: President Donald Trump has announced a new tariff regime, imposing a 10% baseline tax on imports from all nations and higher levies on countries with a trade surplus with the US. This action, justified as correcting trade imbalances, has significantly affected India with a 26% tariff on all its exports, leading to a negative market reaction.
title: Explained: The formula Trump used to decide reciprocal tariffs

description: We live in a time when conversations about marriage are evolving rapidly, and a recent viral courtroom video is at the center of a heated debate: Is financial stability a must before you get married? The viral clip, featuring a judge grilling a man about his income (or lack of it), has triggered a storm of opinions across social media.
title: Judge to man: “You have no right to marry without an income” – Viral video sparks debate

description: Mohsin Naqvi, the new Asian Cricket Council president and current PCB chairman, aims to enhance Asian cricket's growth and influence. Succeeding Shammi Silva, Naqvi is committed to fostering collaboration and development. Silva, reflecting on his tenure, is confident in Naqvi's leadership to continue advancing the ACC's prominence and achievements in the cricketing world.
title: PCB chief takes charge as Asian Cricket Council president

description: RJ Mahvash clarified in a podcast that she is currently single and skeptical about the concept of marriage. Despite being linked with cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal recently, she expressed that she is focusing on her career and personal growth, keeping marriage-related decisions on hold.
title: RJ Mahvash says ‘I am very much single', amid dating rumours with Yuzvendra Chahal

description: Following Gujarat Titans' eight-wicket victory over Royal Challengers Bengaluru, Sai Sudharsan commended Mohammed Siraj's match-winning three-wicket haul, calling him a "game-changer." Sudharsan praised Siraj's energy and attitude. He also expressed satisfaction with his own batting performance that contributed to the team's success, moving GT up the points table with two wins and one loss.
title: Sai Sudharsan reveals Gujarat Titans' 'game-changer' in IPL 2025

description: Gurindervir Singh's journey from a small village in Punjab to becoming India's fastest man is inspiring. Despite facing adversities like health issues and financial struggles, his determination led him to break national records. With his father's motivation and relentless training, he aims for more success while highlighting the financial challenges faced by Indian athletes.
title: 'Seniors said focus on govt job instead': India's fastest man Gurindervir

description: A UK mother Natasha Emeny from Lincoln was shocked when her one-year-old son Koah consumed her father's ashes while she was briefly upstairs handling laundry. Koah, who had never shown interest in the urn before, accessed it and spread the ashes around. Despite the shocking incident, Natasha later found some humor in the situation, which attracted widespread attention.
title: 'Son ate my dad': Mother 'mortified' after toddler eats grandfather's ashes

description: USCIS has updated its policy to recognize only two biological sexes, aligning with President Trump's 2025 executive order. This change affects all pending and future immigration benefit requests, determining sex based on the birth certificate issued at or closest to the time of birth.
title: USCIS' 'plain and straight message' to H1-B, Green Card visa applicants: There are only two...

description: The Rajya Sabha debates the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, following its passage in the Lok Sabha. With the NDA holding a slight numerical advantage in the Upper House, the bill, if approved, will proceed to the President for final assent.
title: Waqf Bill: How numbers stack up in Rajya Sabha

description: President Donald Trump announced broad tariffs affecting most nations, excluding Russia, citing existing sanctions that limit trade. Despite seeking enhanced trade relations with Russia, US trade figures with Russia have significantly declined, and experts question Trump's strategy given the larger commercial opportunities with Canada, Mexico, and Europe.
title: Why is Russia missing from Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs list?

description: This 100-year-old doctor’s wisdom is backed by decades of research and personal experience. While modern medicine has advanced, the power of lifestyle choices remains unmatched. Adopting these principles can lead to a healthier, longer, and more fulfilling life.
title: 100-year-old doctor shares 7 principles of good health and longevity

description: Jeweller Sahil Sakaria Jain is suspected of assisting actor Ranya Rao in selling 49kg of smuggled gold worth over Rs 40 crore. Jain also managed hawala transactions, transferring significant sums of money to Dubai, and was paid a commission for each transaction.
title: 49kg gold, Rs 38.4 cr in hawala transfers: How K'taka jeweller helped Ranya

description: Hungary on Thursday said it will quit the International Criminal Court, just as Prime Minister Viktor Orban hosted his Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu, whom the tribunal has accused of war crimes in Gaza. Netanyahu was invited last November, a day after the ICC issued an arrest warrant against the Israeli leader for crimes against humanity and war crimes.
title: Hungary announces ICC withdrawal as Israel's Netanyahu visits

description: The world added the smallest amount of new coal capacity in two decades last year, a report said Thursday, but use of the fossil fuel is still surging in China and India. Last year also saw a record number of new coal proposals in India, the report warned.
title: New coal capacity hit 20-year low in 2024: report

description: Pakistan cricketer Saud Shakeel humorously criticized the PCB's instability in coaching appointments. Amid this chaos, Pakistan faced another defeat as New Zealand won by 84 runs, securing the series. New Zealand's Mitchell Hay scored an unbeaten 99, while Pakistan's Faheem Ashraf's 73 fell short. Pakistan now aims to avoid a whitewash in the final ODI.
title: Pakistan cricketer mocks PCB, says 'if I become chairman ... '

description: Life-size hoardings of rape-convicted preacher Bajinder Singh have been unlawfully placed along highways in Punjab's Mohali district, violating Supreme Court directives. This blatant breach of legal restrictions poses a significant traffic hazard, with local authorities failing to prevent the unauthorized displays.
title: Punjab highway hoardings defy law, glorify rapist pastor Bajinder Singh

description: Aam Aadmi Party MP Raghav Chadha proposed using Elon Musk's Starlink satellite internet as leverage to renegotiate tariffs imposed by the US. Trump's recent announcement included a 27% reciprocal tariff on India, citing unfair trade practices by India against the US.
title: 'Use Starlink as bargaining chip': AAP's advise to Centre on Trump's tariffs

description: Elon Musk will stay in his role to reduce federal spending until his mission at DOGE is complete, despite speculation of his early departure. His significant cost-cutting efforts have led to layoffs and restructuring but sparked controversy, legal challenges, and protests. The White House and Musk have both confirmed his commitment to achieving his objectives.
title: When will Elon Musk resign from DOGE? All that you need to know

description: The US has exempted Indian pharmaceuticals from tariffs amidst President Trump’s broad tariff imposition, recognizing their crucial role in global healthcare. This move reinforces India’s position as a key provider of affordable generic medicines. Leaders highlight the strategic importance of the bilateral trade relationship, with the exemption offering India a chance to enhance its pharmaceutical sector.
title: Why Trump excluded India's pharma from reciprocal tariffs

description: The US government has implemented a ban on its personnel in China, including diplomats and their families, from engaging in romantic relationships with Chinese citizens. Initiated in January by former Ambassador Nicholas Burns, the policy aims to mitigate espionage risks and is enforced through immediate expulsion for any violations.
title: US prohibits its officials in China from dating Chinese citizens

description: Over 260 passengers of a Virgin Atlantic flight from London to Mumbai are stranded at Turkey's Diyarbakır Airport for over 18 hours. The flight had been diverted due to a medical emergency and later faced technical issues. Passengers are complaining about the lack of arrangements and inedible food while they await further information.
title: 18 hrs & counting: 265 flyers on London-Mumbai flight stuck in Turkey

description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee expressed discontent with the Supreme Court's ruling upholding the cancellation of 25,000 teacher and non-teaching staff appointments in government schools. The court found large-scale manipulation in the recruitment process, ordering a fresh recruitment drive while allowing non-tainted candidates to return to previous government positions.
title: 'Can't accept judgment': CM Banerjee on SC's teachers' appointment ruling

description: Fear and confusion have gripped villages near Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh after recent wild animal attacks. While villagers suspect cheetahs, wildlife officials assert leopards are to blame. The tension peaked when villagers attacked a family of cheetahs.
title: Cheetahs get the blame for leopard attacks near Kuno National Park

description: Rishabh Pant, after a remarkable IPL 2024 return post a serious car accident, is struggling in IPL 2025 with the Lucknow Super Giants. Despite high expectations and a record Rs 27 crore deal, Pant's batting form has been poor. Former player Piyush Chawla attributes his difficulties to form, not pressure, stressing his need for a game-changing innings.
title: 'It's not Rs 27 crore price tag that's affecting Rishabh Pant'

description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and Dell founder Michael Dell have exited the $100 billion club due to significant declines in their fortunes, impacted by market volatility and investor concerns. Both leaders have seen their net worth drop notably, with Dell losing $24.5 billion and Huang losing $19.2 billion this year.
title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and Dell CEO Michael Dell out of $100 billion club

description: The UPSC has released the admit cards for the National Defence Academy & Naval Academy Examination (I), 2025, also known as NDA 1 2025, on April 3. The exam is scheduled for April 13, 2025. Candidates can download their hall tickets from the official UPSC website. The exam will be held in two sessions: Mathematics and the General Ability Test. Aspirants are required to bring their admit card and a valid photo ID for entry.
title: UPSC NDA admit card 2025 released: Download your hall ticket

description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese fell off a stage while posing for photos at a Mining and Energy Union conference in Lovedale. He assured the crowd he was unharmed. Earlier, climate activists disrupted his hospital visit. Despite recent setbacks, polling indicates increased support for Albanese, with him leading as the preferred prime minister ahead of the upcoming federal election.
title: Watch: Australia PM Albanese stumbles off stage while posing for photos

description: 18-year-old entrepreneur Zach Yadegari's rejection from Harvard, Yale, and Stanford has sparked debate after he shared an open letter addressing their admissions processes. Despite impressive academic and entrepreneurial credentials, his rejection raises questions about the values of elite institutions and the accessibility of higher education.
title: 18-year-old AI millionaire Zach Yadegari sends open letter after Ivy rejections

description: Rahul Gandhi criticized the BJP for its handling of the India-China border issue and US tariffs, accusing them of submission to foreign interests. He claimed China is occupying 4,000 sq km of Indian territory and urged for status quo restoration. Gandhi also expressed concern over the Foreign Secretary's interaction with the Chinese envoy.
title: 'China took 4,000 km, we’re cutting cake,' says Rahul; BJP takes 'soup' jibe

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is flouting an arrest warrant on a visit to Budapest. The International Criminal Court has limited means to respond.
title: Netanyahu visits Hungary, defying ICC arrest warrant
PM Modi showcases India’s spiritual legacy worldwide

description: Sunrisers Hyderabad's Nitish Kumar Reddy shares his admiration for MS Dhoni's captaincy, Virat Kohli's aggression, and Rohit Sharma's pull shot. Reddy, eager for IPL face-offs, looks forward to challenging Jasprit Bumrah post his recovery. Acknowledging the impact of cricket legends, he aspires to continue their legacy in Indian cricket, beginning with their match against Mumbai Indians on April 17.
title: SRH star reveals what he wants to have from Dhoni, Kohli, and Rohit

description: US President Donald Trump announced extensive reciprocal tariff proposals, significantly affecting India with an extra 27% duty. The Commerce Department is assessing the impacts. Both nations aim to boost trade to $500 billion by 2030, with continuous negotiations for a bilateral trade agreement. The India-US relationship focuses on enhancing trade, investments, and technology transfers.
title: This is how Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs will roll out in India

description: RCB head coach Andy Flower confirmed that Virat Kohli's finger injury is not a major concern. Kohli hurt his finger while fielding against Gujarat Titans.
title: 'Virat looks fine, there's no worry' - RCB coach

description: In Maharashtra, MNS workers aggressively demanded the use of Marathi in banks. They confronted a bank manager in Ambarnath who was not conversing in Marathi, threatened him, and vandalized a computer. The workers demanded that he learn Marathi quickly. This follows MNS Chief Raj Thackeray's recent call to make Marathi mandatory for official communication.
title: MNS activists confront bank manager in Thane for not conversing in Marathi

description: Uddhav Thackeray criticized the BJP for not addressing the economic challenges posed by impending US tariffs and accused the party of continuing to provoke Hindu-Muslim tensions despite securing a third term at the Centre. He also challenged the BJP to remove the green color from its flag if it disliked Muslims.
title: BJP's 'concern' for Muslims would put Jinnah to shame: Uddhav on Waqf bill

description: All 33 Supreme Court judges in New Delhi have resolved to voluntarily make their assets public on the court’s website, as decided in an April 1 meeting. This move, aiming to improve transparency, comes following a recent scandal involving a large cash recovery and past decisions calling for asset disclosure.
title: CJI, Supreme Court judges to make asset details public

description: Mallikarjun Kharge demands an apology from BJP's Anurag Thakur for making 'baseless' allegations against him in the Lok Sabha. The Congress leader emphasized his long-standing integrity in public life and condemned Thakur's remarks as defamatory. Kharge also urged the Leader of the House, J P Nadda, to address this issue.
title: Kharge demands apology from Anurag Thakur over land grab allegations
Lok Sabha passes Waqf Bill: Which parties supported, who opposed?

description: US President Donald Trump has announced new tariffs affecting all trade partners, including an uninhabited island territory, Heard and McDonald Islands. The 10% tariffs are part of what Trump called 'Liberation Day tariffs,' causing reactions from Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese. Other Australian territories like Norfolk Island face higher tariffs.
title: No people, just penguins & seals: Trump imposes tariff on uninhabited island

description: Suryakumar Yadav and other Mumbai Indians players visited the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya for blessings ahead of their IPL match against Lucknow Super Giants. Despite a recent dip in form, Yadav has started to find his groove in this year’s IPL, scoring consistently with impressive strike rates in his recent outings.
title: Photos: SKY seeks blessings at Ayodhya's Ram Mandir ahead of LSG vs MI

description: It is less likely that Salman Khan starrer 'Sikandar' will cross Rs 100 crore even on Day 5 which is not expected out of such a movie. The film saw a 50 percent drop in the business on day 4 which is Wednesday and now the day 5 number may see a slight drop further.
title: ‘Sikandar’ day 5 collection: Salman starrer struggles to hit Rs 100 cr mark

description: In a 1988 interview with Oprah Winfrey, US President Donald Trump highlighted his stance on making American allies pay their fair share, citing trade issues with Japan and Kuwait. He criticized these countries for their unfair trade practices and luxurious lifestyles subsidized by the US while announcing new tariffs on imports.
title: Trump's 1988 interview resurfaces — Why it’s trending amid tariff move

description: Sleeping with bright lights on can negatively impact blood sugar levels and cardiometabolic health, as found in a 2022 study. Researchers observed increased insulin resistance, higher heart rates, and decreased deep sleep in individuals exposed to light. Experts recommend a regular sleep routine, avoiding screens before bed, and maintaining a dark, cool, quiet sleep environment.
title: Diabetes, heart attack have this strange connection with your bedroom lighting

description: President Trump’s new tariff plan includes a 10% universal tariff on imports, followed by country-specific tariffs. China faces the highest tariffs, up to 54%. India’s textile, electronics, and machinery sectors may benefit from competitive advantages. However, to capitalize on these opportunities, India must address structural issues and enhance manufacturing capabilities.
title: Explained: India likely to gain as Trump tariff shake-up hits China hard

description: Kolkata Knight Riders and Sunrisers Hyderabad find themselves at the bottom of the IPL 2025 points table. KKR's batting lineup is inconsistent, and SRH struggles in powerplays. The Eden Gardens pitch might favor spinners, with both teams looking to improve their standings.
title: IPL match today: KKR vs SRH - all you need to know

description: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman revealed that in its early days, employees were expected to continue working from home after dinner with their families. Hoffman's stance signifies a demanding culture deemed essential for startup success and believes it drives significant financial rewards for those who embrace it.
title: LinkedIn co-founder to employees: Go home, have dinner with family

description: Melinda French Gates shares insights into her decision to end her marriage to Bill Gates in her new memoir, revealing it was spurred by recurring nightmares and her husband's infidelity. She discusses the challenging divorce process and emphasizes the importance of staying true to oneself.
title: Melinda Gates shares the ‘scariest conversation’ on divorce she had with Bill Gates

description: Scientists have discovered four new Earth-like rocky planets orbiting Barnard's Star, just six light-years away. Using advanced technology, these are the smallest exoplanets detected via the radial velocity method. Though too hot for life, their discovery aids in understanding planetary compositions and the potential for life in our galactic neighborhood.
title: Scientists discover four Earth-like planets orbiting Barnard's Star

description: India's agricultural exports to the US may remain strong despite increased reciprocal tariffs by the Trump administration. With comparative advantages over competitors like China, Vietnam, and Thailand, Indian products like seafood and rice are expected to maintain demand.
title: Trump reciprocal tariffs: Why India’s agri exports likely to be little affected

description: A mix-up on social media led Virat Kohli's fans to mistakenly target Bollywood actor Arshad Warsi's Instagram with hate messages after GT bowler Arshad Khan dismissed Kohli for seven runs in an IPL match. RCB lost the game by eight wickets as GT, bolstered by Mohammed Siraj's bowling and Jos Buttler's half-century, secured the win.
title: Virat Kohli fans attack Bollywood star during RCB vs GT - here's why

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Thailand for a two-day visit to participate in the sixth BIMSTEC summit. Modi will engage in discussions with Thai PM Paetongtarn Shinawatra and join BIMSTEC leaders in signing the Agreement on Maritime Cooperation. The visit also includes meetings with key regional leaders and will be followed by Modi's visit to Sri Lanka.
title: Watch: PM greeted with ‘Modi, Modi’ chants as he arrives in Thailand

description: A Meerut court extended the judicial custody of Muskan Rastogi and Sahil Shukla for another 14 days in connection with the murder of Muskan's husband, Saurabh Rajput. They appeared via video conferencing and were kept in separate barracks. Muskan and Sahil have admitted to the gruesome crime.
title: Meerut murder: Muskan breaks down on seeing lover in video call
'Brazen assault on Constitution': Sonia Gandhi slams Waqf Bill

description: US President Trump has exempted Indian pharmaceuticals from new reciprocal tariffs, benefiting India's pharmaceutical sector. This sector is vital for affordable medicines and economic stability, with the US market representing 30% of Indian exports.
title: Cheer on reciprocal tariffs! Trump spares India’s pharmaceutical industry
India's 'burdensome' rules make it 'costly' for US cos to operate: White House

description: Infosys has filed fresh charges against Cognizant in a US court, accusing it of anti-competitive practices to maintain dominance in the healthcare software market. The legal battle, which began with Cognizant's allegations of trade secret theft, has now intensified with claims of monopolistic behavior and obstruction of fair competition.
title: Infosys files fresh charges against Cognizant in the US court; says…

description: Lucknow Super Giants received a boost with pacer Akash Deep joining ahead of their IPL match against Mumbai Indians. After recovering from a back injury, Akash Deep is now fit and set to enhance LSG's bowling lineup. He bolsters the team amidst injuries to players like Mayank Yadav and Mohsin Khan, making this crucial for LSG's playoff hopes.
title: IPL 2025: Big boost for LSG ahead of MI clash in Lucknow

description: The death toll from Myanmar's recent 7.7 magnitude earthquake has reached 3,085, with 341 people still missing and over 4,700 injured. The military junta has announced a temporary ceasefire to aid rescue operations, amidst ongoing efforts by international teams providing nearly 1,000 tonnes of relief supplies.
title: Myanmar earthquake death toll surpasses 3,000
'Process tainted': SC invalidates appointment of over 25,000 teachers in Bengal schools

description: China expressed strong opposition to the new US tariffs, which include a 10 percent base tariff on global imports and an additional 34 per cent targeting China. Beijing condemned the move as violating international trade norms, harming global economic development, and destabilising supply chains. The Chinese commerce ministry urged Washington to cancel the tariffs.
title: 'Typical bullying practice': China's sharp response to Trump's tariffs move

description: Amit Mishra, a Bengaluru-based entrepreneur, shared a frightening health scare on LinkedIn, with his blood pressure soaring to 230 and landing him in the ICU. His experience highlights the hidden dangers of modern work culture and underscores the importance of balancing work and health, emphasizing regular checkups and emergency preparedness.
title: Bengaluru CEO hospitalised as blood pressure hits 230, shares 'important learnings'

description: A 31-year-old Indian national in the US, Sai Kumar Kurremula, has been sentenced to 35 years for child exploitation and distributing child pornography. He manipulated children via social media and blackmailed them with inappropriate content when they did not comply with his demands. Kurremula admitted to exploiting three minors and was arrested following an FBI investigation.
title: Indian national sentenced to 35 years in US for sexual exploitation of minors

description: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal revealed that the Krutrim AI assistant version two will be ready for release in April, emphasizing its 'DeepSearch' feature. Krutrim, India's first AI unicorn, aims to provide generative AI functions for Indian languages with its large language model.
title: Ola CEO shares update on Krutrim AI chatbot: ‘I personally love the…’

description: Reportedly, Salman Khan’s lookalike, Aazam Ansari, has been arrested in Lucknow for blocking the road, arguing with people, and allegedly making a video with a gun. Ansari claimed he was unfairly detained while drinking tea. The police cited his expired gun license as a major concern and he alleges he was mistreated by police and faces difficulties obtaining bail.
title: Salman Khan’s lookalike held in Lucknow for making video with gun
Trump torments world with punitive tariff on all, including allies

description: Franchises in the Indian Premier League have expressed dissatisfaction with pitch preparations not aligning with their strengths. The BCCI instructs curators to prepare balanced pitches, causing possible friction with teams desiring home advantages.
title: IPL 2025: 'Surface' tension irks franchises

description: Yashasvi Jaiswal has decided to transfer from Mumbai to Goa for the upcoming domestic season, highlighting his career aspirations and personal circumstances. His inclusion in the Goan squad is seen as a significant opportunity for local players to learn from a national team member.
title: Jaiswal’s switch hit: From elite Mumbai to minnows Goa

description: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Thursday after US President Donald Trump announced 26% reciprocal tariffs on India. While BSE Sensex dipped over 500 points, Nifty50 was near 23,200.
title: Sensex tanks over 500 points as Trump imposes 26% reciprocal tariffs on India

description: On April 2, 2025, President Trump announced tariffs to assert US economic independence, targeting countries including China. He insists this will revitalise domestic manufacturing, though it risks a global trade war. Trump expressed frustration with international trade practices, vowing to boost jobs and industry within the US while portraying his measures as a necessary resistance against foreign exploitation.
title: 'They're ripping us off & they understood it': Key quotes from Trump's speech

description: President Donald Trump announced a 10% baseline tariff on all US imports, excluding Canada and Mexico, intensifying a trade war. World leaders, including those from Canada, Australia, Spain, Ireland, and Italy, expressed concerns and vowed countermeasures to protect their economies and workers while condemning the potential negative impacts of these tariffs.
title: 'Going to fight': How world leaders reacted to Trump's tariff move

description: US President Trump labeled Prime Minister Modi as his 'great friend' while announcing a 26% retaliatory tariff on India, addressing the trade imbalance and high Indian tariffs on US goods. Trump emphasized the need for negotiations to create a level playing field and highlighted the substantial US trade deficit with India.
title: 'Great friend, but ...': What Trump said about PM Modi and India in tariff speech

description: Defending champions Kolkata Knight Riders and Sunrisers Hyderabad are desperate to regain momentum with two losses each in their three respective matches so far in IPL 2025. Both teams need strong opening partnerships for success, considering their past performances as top Powerplay scorers in the last edition of the IPL.
title: KKR vs SRH: Focus on opening acts in replay of 2024 final

description: Mohammed Siraj reflects on his emotional return to M Chinnaswamy Stadium, now playing for Gujarat Titans against his former team, RCB. Siraj's impressive performance, claiming three wickets, earned him Player of the Match. He credits his success to the guidance of Ashish Nehra and Ishant Sharma, and fans, with his Ronaldo-inspired celebration.
title: Siraj gets emotional on Chinnaswamy return: 'I was here for seven years'

description: Top stock market recommendations: Aakash K Hindocha recommends Computer Age Management Services, PCBL Chemical, and Balrampur Chini Mills for today. Following significant market movement, Nifty is poised for potential retracement while Bank Nifty shows resilience.
title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for April 3

description: Zach Yadegari, an 18-year-old entrepreneur earning $30 million annually from his AI startup, Cal AI, was rejected by elite universities like Harvard and MIT despite a 4.0 GPA. His admissions essay questioning the necessity of college education might have played a role. However, he was accepted into top schools like Georgia Institute of Technology and University of Miami.
title: Who is Zach Yadegari, the 18-year-old millionaire rejected by top universities?

description: Tesla reported a 13% drop in Q1 deliveries, falling short of Wall Street expectations. CEO Elon Musk faces criticism over his association with President Trump and DOGE, while production disruptions and vandalism attacks compounded issues. Rivals like Rivian also struggled. Musk aims to stabilize Tesla with new products and autonomous driving software.
title: Disaster on every metric ...: Musk's DOGE is hurting Tesla; this may be a proof
Buy or sell: What brokerages are recommending today

description: Salman Khan and Rashmika Mandanna's 'Sikandar' was released on March 30, 2025, and has accumulated ₹84.45 crore in four days. Despite its high initial expectations, the film received mixed reviews and witnessed a substantial post-Eid drop in earnings, recording a 50% decline on day 4.
title: ‘Sikandar’ day 4 box office: Salman-Rashmika film stays under Rs 10 crore

description: Google has replaced the head of its consumer AI division, with Sissie Hsiao stepping down and Josh Woodward taking over. This change aims to accelerate the development of the Gemini application. Despite a rocky start, Google's AI tools have shown significant improvements, outperforming competitors in recent benchmarks.
title: Google AI chatbot Gemini head steps down; read Google DeepMind CEO memo to employees

description: The adoption process in India remains lengthy, with an average wait time of three and a half years for infants. Despite the number of adoptions reaching over 4,500 in 2024-25, thousands of prospective parents continue to wait anxiously, with the demand for younger children far exceeding available orphans for adoption.
title: Average adoption waiting period climbs to 3.5 years

description: The 2001 Nepalese royal massacre resulted in the monarchy's end and a republic with frequent leadership changes. Rising disillusionment among the youth has led to a resurgence of pro-monarchy sentiments, driven by political instability and a lack of direction. Many students are calling for reliable governance.
title: In Nepal's classrooms, youngsters wonder if republic has delivered

description: The Supreme Court criticized the Uttarakhand government's 2009 policy requiring non-state students in MBBS courses to serve in remote areas or pay Rs 30 lakh. The court emphasized that this policy should be a uniform decision by the Union government, citing challenges faced by students from other states in serving in inaccessible regions.
title: SC: State can't decide on rural stints for doctors from outside

description: A Jaguar fighter jet crashed near Jamnagar during a training mission, killing one pilot and injuring another. The incident caused a massive fire and panic among nearby villagers. Emergency teams responded quickly, and the injured pilot was taken to GG Hospital. The exact cause of the crash remains unknown.
title: IAF fighter jet crashes in Gujarat's Jamnagar, one pilot dead

description: A housewife disabled from an accident has been abandoned at Apollo Multispeciality Hospitals for over two years. Her husband claims he is unable to care for her, and the outstanding hospital bill is Rs 1 crore. The court has directed the state counsel to suggest a remedy.
title: 'Bill now Rs 1cr': Husband dumps paralysed wife in hospital for 2 years

description: The government incurred a loss of Rs 1,757.56 crore as BSNL failed to bill Reliance Jio for passive infrastructure sharing for a decade, as revealed by a CAG report. Additionally, BSNL's negligence in its agreement with RJIL resulted in further revenue losses due to non-adherence to the escalation clause.
title: How BSNL's 'Reliance Jio mistake' may have cost the govt Rs 1,757 crore

description: The Bharuch police solved a gruesome murder where Shailendra Chauhan chopped his friend Sachin into nine pieces over private photos and a loan dispute. Shailendra, disguising himself as a woman, disposed of the body parts at various locations, which initially baffled investigators. He was eventually caught in Bijnor.
title: Bharuch horror: Friend chops man into 9 pieces, dresses up as woman to dispose parts
